title: FAQ - How do you find the seeding rate for different cover crops?

tasks.task: Understanding and Setting Seeding Rates for Cover Crop Seeds
subtasks: Retrieving seeding rate information from the seed analysis sheet
Calculating seeding rate if bushel weight is not provided
Determining bushel weight for a seed mix
Adjusting drill settings based on bushel weight
Performing a drill calibration using empirical methods
Using a bushel weight apparatus for setting the drill

tasks.task: Managing Seed Analysis Sheets and Product Delivery
subtasks: Accessing seed analysis sheets in seed tote
Checking for bushel weight and seeding rate information on delivered seed
Using an example mix to convert pounds to bushels
Highlighting differences in settings required for different seeds
Performing a manual drill calibration calculations
Reminding users of the importance of calibration over adjusting future orders

tasks.task: All tasks relate to the physical actions required in handling seed analysis, determining seeding rates, calibrating planting equipment, and managing seed delivery within the context of cover crop planting. Each subtask breaks down the overall maintenance (MAINTASK) needed to effectively seed cover crops.
